intro: Turraea longilimba, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
